page.title: 08CHURCHES: STATHAM/WOOLSTON
page.content:
At the South Western edge of our area lies the Roman Catholic church of {St. Winifred, Statham.}This small church with no tower or spire was built in 1933. It has a beautiful mosaic over the front door. Inside the church can be seen several paintings and some lovely pictures of the stations of the cross.
To the North is a second Catholic church, that of{St Peter, Woolston.} Opened in 1835 it is this year celebrating its 150th anniversary. The church has been on the same site throughout its existence at first surrounded by fields now by suburbs. In 1974 the outside of the church was refaced with a sturdy white dressing and this year it has been decorated inside and reordered.
